definition: to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: They contributed a lot to the development of the art of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 無題詩對詩歌藝術的發展貢獻很大。

sentences.english: For more information see the dust loose old walls, and death poem dash of people.
sentences.chinese: 欲知松老看塵壁，死卻題詩幾許人。

sentences.english: The novels written by "Poems on Red Leaf" in the Tang & Five Dynasties have long enjoyed popularity since their emergence.
sentences.chinese: 唐五代“紅葉題詩”小說自它產生之日起便盛傳不衰。

sentences.english: Taste for bamboo, a poem to express his and all Jiamiao.
sentences.chinese: 嘗作墨竹，題詩寄意，並皆佳妙。

definition: interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]

various sages/refers to the classical schools of thought, e.g. Confucianism 儒[ru2] represented by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3], Daoism 道[dao4] by Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3] and Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3], Mohism 墨[mo4] by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], Legalism 法[fa3] by Sunzi 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3] and Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子[Han2 Fei1 zi3], and numerous others
Canglang district of Suzhou city 蘇州市|苏州市[Su1 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
